result.execSummary:
The defendant Nadine P Hindsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: A payment plan has been granted as follows:  $25 is due on or before 7-1-16 and then $25 is due by the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay the fine and court costs in full by the due date will result in serving 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  A $15 payment plan fee has been added to the payment plan.
Must submit a DNA sample at the Jackson County Jail and pay the surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nadine P Hindsley

defendant.name: Hindsley, Nadine P
defendant.address: W8871 Decorah Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense stipulates to revocation of DPA and she wishes to plea to the original charge today.  His recommendation is a fine and costs.  Court questions defendant regarding revocation.  Court grants the Motion to Revoke the DPA.  Court reviews the charge and penalties with defendant.  She pleads guilty to the charge.  Judge reviews the elements of the crime/plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint.  There is a joint recommendation of a fine and costs.  Court finds the defendant understands the proceedings and FVI enters her plea/waives her rights.  Court makes a finding of guilty of the original charge.  State recommends a fine of $100 plus costs.  The State notifies the Court there is no victim in this case.  Court orders $100 fine plus costs for a total of $579.  There is no credit for time served.  Court orders that a DNA sample must be submitted plus must pay the surcharge.  A payment plan is granted at the amount of $25 per month commencing 7-1-16.  FTP will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Motion hearing to revoke scheduled per telehpone request of ADA Inlow this date
courtesy copy of letter sent by Attorney Linehan to ADA Inlow

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Have an agreement.  Pre-plea diversion agreement will be entered into.  State will file a motion to dismiss upon completion.

Pre-trial conference at 11-11-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-30-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with  Attorney Linehan.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered.  PTC set for 11/11 at STC 11/30/15 at 3 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  She will have counsel through SPD.  She went there this AM.  AIA set for 10/19/15 at 9:30 am.  She was told to make sure SPD will have someone present next week.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  She hasn't contacted an attorney yet.  AIA 1 more week to contact SPD.  10/12 at 9:30.  Options explained again.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with:  J. H. or anyone else in the household.

In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with:  J. H. or anyone else in the household.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  She understands.  Court advised the defendant to contact SPD.  Other options explained.  AIA set for 9/28/15 at 9:30 am.
